author: samwilsn
content:
I'm about to go to bed, so I'll just leave some words that I've barely thought about so I'll have some interesting reading tomorrow morning. First, I don't think anyone involved needs an explicit punishment. In the grand scheme of things, considered solely on its own, this is a very insignificant dispute between editors over what digits to assign to a blob of text. Yes, it has implications, but at its core, it's basically nothing.

I think the two things we need to do to improve the process here are:

1. From now on, discuss any potentially contentious actions in public, either here or in the ECH discord. Get participation from those you know feel strongly, and don't consider silence consent. Maybe put this in EIP-5069?
2. Add a rule explicitly prohibiting vanity EIP numbers to EIP-1, if it isn't already mentioned.

author: sky.cactus
content:
I agree that the specific issue at hand is insignificant.  If the issue at hand was somehow contained to that I would care far less.  What concerns me far more is the *willingness* of editors to take an action that they almost certainly know is contentious among the editors at best and is against the de facto rules at worst.  Worse, they did so in a way that appears to attempt to avoid/prevent engagement with the other editors (private conversations rather than public) implying intentional subversion.

As Killari alluded to, if we have editors that are actively trying to subvert the system I don't think there exists any set of rules we could implement that would address the root problem.  What we need are editors who don't try to subvert/game the system.  This is certainly a hard problem, and one that every system of governance suffers from with with no known foolproof solution.

author: sky.cactus
content: We can create a bunch of rules that try to constrain the actions of the editors so they are limited in what they can do and there are well define grounds on which we can then exert punishment, but a clever editor who wants to subvert the rules will eventually find a way and we'll be right back in this situation again and again, constantly adding rules and complexity.
